intro: Fumaria capreolata f. speciosa, commonly known as the showy fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, cascading clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often have a distinctive reddish or purplish hue. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This ornamental plant is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive floral display and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
